newsitem.title: UK: UK Treasury sees downward pressure on inflation.
newsitem.headline: UK Treasury sees downward pressure on inflation.

text.p: Alan Budd, chief economic adviser to the Treasury, said on Tuesday he believed there was still some spare capacity in the UK economy which was putting downard pressure on inflation.

"We believe there is some spare capacity in this economy which is tending to put downward pressure on inflation, and also fairly favourable cost indicators with the exception of oil," he told the Treasury Select Committee.
"Other commodity prices have been flat or falling and we have fairly subdued earnings increases. We take (those) as favourable indicators as far as inflation next year is concerned," Budd added.
